title: Microsoft Sharepoint outage caused by use of wrong TLS certificate
description: Microsoft Sharepoint and OneDrive for Business were briefly interrupted today after a German TLS certificate was mistakenly added to the main .com domains for the Microsoft 365 services. [...]

title: Zenbleed attack leaks sensitive data from AMD Zen2 processors
description: Google's security researcher Tavis Ormandy discovered a new vulnerability impacting AMD Zen2 CPUs that could allow a malicious actor to steal sensitive data, such as passwords and encryption keys, at a rate of 30KB/sec from each CPU core. [...]

title: Lazarus hackers hijack Microsoft IIS servers to spread malware
description: The North Korean state-sponsored Lazarus hacking group is breaching Windows Internet Information Service (IIS) web servers to hijack them for malware distribution. [...]

title: Ivanti patches MobileIron zero-day bug exploited in attacks
description: US-based IT software company Ivanti has patched an actively exploited zero-day vulnerability impacting its Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) mobile device management software (formerly MobileIron Core). [...]

title: Apple fixes new zero-day used in attacks against iPhones, Macs
description: Apple has released security updates to address zero-day vulnerabilities exploited in attacks targeting iPhones, Macs, and iPads. [...]

title: Flipper Zero now has its own app store for iOS, Android users
description: The Flipper Zero team has launched its very own 'Flipper Apps' mobile app store, allowing mobile users to install 3rd-party apps and extend the functionality of the popular wireless pen-testing tool. [...]

title: JumpCloud hack linked to North Korea after OPSEC mistake
description: A hacking unit of North Korea's Reconnaissance General Bureau (RGB) was linked to the JumpCloud breach after the attackers made an operational security (OPSEC) mistake, inadvertently exposing their real-world IP addresses. [...]

title: Microsoft shares fix for some Outlook hyperlinks not opening
description: Microsoft shared a workaround for Outlook Desktop blocking attempts to open IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) hyperlinks after installing this month's security updates. [...]

title: Norwegian government IT systems hacked using zero-day flaw
description: The Norwegian government is warning that its ICT platform used by 12 ministries has suffered a cyberattack after hackers exploited a zero-day vulnerability in third-party software. [...]

title: How is the Dark Web Reacting to the AI Revolution?
description: Cybercriminals are already utilizing and creating malicious tools based on open source AI language models for phishing and malware development. Learn more from Flare about how threat actors are beginning to use AI. [...]
